history.content:
Yikes!  Sorry for the delayed response.

We will be doing the  class again in Spring.  We just got the chips back from the 

designs that the students did last semester.  We're just starting testing!

EE194/290C 28 nm SoC for IoT

TuTh 3:30-5 pm.

Pre-reqs: at least one of EE140, 142, 151; (or equiv)

In 15 weeks we will design a single-chip wireless sensor node "System on a Chip"

with a 32 bit RISC-V processor and memory, 2.4 GHz radio transceiver, energy

scavenging interface, power management, on-board sensors, and sensor interfaces.

The (extremely challenging) goal is to send the chip out for fabrication in 28 nm CMOS

at the end of the semester. One or more teams of students will divide the project into

modules and work together to design and integrate the modules into a single chip.

Topics include: Analog/RF mixed-signal ASIC toolchain: layout, synthesis, extraction,

verfication; design for test; matlab system modeling; interface design; floorplanning;

system simulation. Overwork likely. Not for the faint of heart.
Is there any info about Professor Pister's EE 194? I tried digging around, but I couldn't find anything regarding the Spring '18 version.
history.subject: EE 194
